tutorial.title: Present Value of a Lease with Residual Value
tutorial.scenario:
The Hobocus Company wants to purchase a machine currently leased from your company. You offer to sell it for the present value of the lease discounted at an annual interest rate of 20% compounded monthly. The machine has a residual value of $8,000 with 36 monthly payments of $1,500 remaining on the lease. If the payments are due at the beginning of each month, how much should you charge for the machine?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Press the BGN button to set beginning-of-period payments.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 36), and then press the N button.
Enter the periodic interest rate (in this case 20/12), and then press the = button followed by the I/Y button.
Enter the residual value of the asset (in this case 8000), and then press the +/- button followed by the FV button.
Enter the periodic payment (in this case 1500), and then press the +/- button followed by the PMT button.
Press the CPT button and then the PV button to solve for the present value of the lease payment.
